title: Activated Cadmium
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Cadmium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

title: Activated Copper
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Copper has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

title: Activated Emeril
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

title: Activated Indium
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

This Indium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

title: Activated Quartzite
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting purple stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

This Quartzite has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

title: Ammonia
description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an toxic environment.

title: Ancestral Memories
description:
The echo of a genetic possibility, forgotten by evolution. It twitches with a wild energy.

Extracted from a creature caught within a repeating circuit of time. Of great value to Specialist Polo as they research the loop.

title: Atlantideum
description:
This ethereal substance spills from the bodies of corrupted Sentinels as they fall, a shower of prismatic grains seeking out their next host. It evades all attempts to contain it, as if it had a will of its own, a strong desire for its own freedom.

It possesses a crystalline beauty that cannot be reconciled with the corruption from whence it flows.

title: Basalt
description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on planets with a volcanic environment.

title: Cactus Flesh
description: Succulent, edible cactus flesh from the desert planets, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.

title: Cadmium
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

infobox.desc: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star

title: Carbon
description:
The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travellers, as Carbon is used to recharge mining equipment.

The Mining Laser will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetable.

title: Chlorine
description:
A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in oceans.

Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

title: Chromatic Metal
description:
A processed metal alloy, created in a Refiner from the stellar metals: Copper, Cadmium, Emeril and Indium.

The rarer the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce.

This valuable metal is used in the creation of many advanced technologies.

title: Cobalt
description:
Mined from underground minerals, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in Ion Batteries.

It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a Refiner to make the most of its inherent charge.

title: Condensed Carbon
description:
Advanced material, processed from regular carbon in a Refiner.

The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio.

Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require an Advanced Mining Laser.

title: Copper
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

title: Crystallised Helium
description:
A supercooled chemical extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from smaller mineral formations after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Extracted from deposits formed in the hostile conditions of gas giants.

title: Cursed Dust
description:
A powdery desert soil, slick with the gland expressions of a colossal sandworm. Historically, some have regarded this dust as the divine parent of such worms. It smells curiously sweet.

Cursed Dust gathers in the terrain deposits of planets blighted by titan worm activity.

title: Cyto-Phosphate
description:
A blue-green organic compound produced during the metabolic cycle of deep-sea plantlife. Rich in soluble energy, cyto-phosphates are crucial in many submarine technologies.

The Mining Laser will harvest cyto-phosphate compounds from underwater flora.

title: Deuterium
description:
A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology.

Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of Di-hydrogen and Tritium in Refiners.

title: Di-hydrogen
description:
A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures.

Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large blue crystals. It is a key component of Starship Launch Fuel.

title: Dioxite
description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an frozen environment.

title: Emeril
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. 

Emeril is found on planets orbiting green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

title: Faecium
description:
A foul-smelling compound that can be harvested from the Gutrot Flower, or less desirably from the faecal matter of some species.

Creatures can be fed to encourage the formation and deposition of faecium crystals.

title: Farming
description:
Farming provides the ability to plant farmable agricultural Farmer that has been hired for your base or Nexus for 3 Salvaged Data.

An index of player farms can be found at Community Farms.

title: Ferrite Dust
description:
An abundant mineral element, found in rock formations and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a Mining Laser.

Typically requires processing in a Refiner before use in construction or technology manufacture.

title: Fragmented Qualia
description:
A pattern, no more than a mere waveform, etched into the surface of a tiny metallic shard. This fragment of data represents a recording of electrical impulses running across a neural network. Many fragments would be required to recreate any sensible experience.

Generated by the interaction of the Animus Beam with a living target.

title: Frost Crystal
description: A beautiful blue crystal, this organic compound possesses both great hardiness and a shimmering translucence. It is harvested from the leaves of frozen conditions to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.

title: Fuel elements
description:
Fuel elements are mainly used as an ingredient for crafting or refining into various products.

Also glyph 1 / 16, glyph 4 / 16, glyph 7 / 16, glyph 10 / 16 and glyph 13 / 16 are need to be charged with these type of elements, before a portal could be activated.

title: Fungal Mould
description: An oddly-glowing substance, harvested from the gills of toxic climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.

title: Gamma Root
description: A strange substance that seems to slowly shift the air around it. It is found in the roots of the radiation to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.

title: Gold
description:
Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.

title: Harvested Agricultural Substance
description: Harvested Agricultural Substance is a type of resource, grouped under the flora division.

title: Hexite
description: An odourless, mineral-rich substance with a hexagonal crystalline structure, harvested from the faecal matter of a creature.

title: Indium
description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

title: Ionised Cobalt
description:
A highly energised form of Advanced Ion Batteries, a conveniently portable source of energy for the Exosuit.  

In widespread use as a key component in the creation of advanced technologies and structures.

title: Kelp Sac
description:
A rubbery, luminescent sac harvested from underwater Candle Kelp plants.

Agricultural science has not yet tamed the Candle Kelp. As such, these sacs cannot be farmed.

title: Liquid Sun
description:
Conventional planetary metal, superheated and then held in a stabilised plasmatic form.

Extracted from metallic terrain deposits using a Solar Ray. Enormously energetic.

title: Lithium
description:
Local metallic extract, typically found in large deposits or harvested from common mineral formations after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on ocean planets.

title: Living Slime
description:
A heavy, oozing slime. It is moving gently, as if it has a heartbeat of its own.

Nutrient source: unknown.

title: Magnetised Ferrite
description:
Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a Refiner.

Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.

title: Marrow Bulb
description:
A glowing organic bulb, harvested from the Cave Marrow plant found growing underground.

The Cave Marrow has proved resistant to domestication, and no farmable cultivars are known to exist. As such, marrow bulbs must be harvested by hand in the wild.

title: Methane
description:
An atmospheric gas found in hostile conditions of gas giants.

Methane is readily harvested from equipment deployed on gas worlds.

title: Mordite
description:
Despite much study, little is known about this haunting, crystalline compound.

It is released from the cadavers of dying creatures, but can also be specifically cultivated and harvested from the Mordite Root plant.

title: Nanite Cluster
description:
A dense miasma of Nanites, undulating in its potentiality. These clusters are stable, but unrestricted nanite foam can produce undesirable runaway reactions in the presence of organic matter.

Used in the construction of advanced technologies. Highly valuable to specialist traders.

title: Nitrogen
description:
A reactive atmospheric gas found wherever there is organic life.

Nitrogen is readily harvested from the atmospheres of Toxic and Lush planets.

title: Oxygen
description:
Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the life support system.

Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora.

Other plantlife may be scanned with the Analysis Visor to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.

title: Paraffinium
description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an tropical environment.

title: Phosphorus
description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an scorched environment.

title: Platinum
description:
Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.

title: Polished Stone
description:
The powdery remains of a highly polished mineral surface. It glitters as it catches the light, like fiery glands of sand. 

Acquired by applying the Mining Laser to the structural remnants located on ruined worlds.

title: Pugneum
description: This oily, unsettling liquid leaks from the circuitry of Nanites. It hums in a sinister fashion upon contact with organic matter.

title: Pure Ferrite
description:
Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of structures and technologies.

Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a Refiner, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an Advanced Mining Laser.

title: Pyrite
description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on planets with a desert environment.

title: Quartzite
description:
A chromatic mineral, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.
Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting purple stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

title: Radon
description:
A colourless, odourless gas with a relatively short half-life.

Found in both Radioactive and Frozen atmospheres, this gas is produced by the decay of other high-energy elements.

title: Raw Materials
description: Raw Materials is a visual index page as presented in the in-game Catalogue.

title: Residual Goop
description:
A pulsating, foul smelling goop that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Skin contact is not advised.

title: Runaway Mould
description:
An out of control mould growth that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Likely to be several different species of mould, merged together into one super-colony.

title: Rusted Metal
description:
Handfuls of corroded metal, distorted by years of exposure to the harsh environment.

Handle with care.

title: Salt
description:
A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in underwater minerals.

Can be processed in a Refiner to create Chlorine. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.

title: Silicate Powder
description:
An abundant mineral element, found within the geological strata of all rocky worlds. Easily extracted using a Terrain Manipulator. Create a tunnel anywhere to begin extraction.

Process in a Refiner to create Glass.

title: Silver
description:
Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.

title: Sodium
description:
A powerful catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection.

Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate sodium-rich flora.

A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.

title: Sodium Nitrate
description:
An advanced catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection.

Created in a Refiner, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface.

Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.

title: Solanium
description:
thumb|Solar Vine plant, the source of Solanium
A powerful chemical that has resisted attempts at synthesis. It can be harvested from the bark of the hot climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.

title: Somnal Dust
description:
Grey, dead, sparkling with life and colour, singing as it shimmers. This impossibly fine dust is the accumulated decay of time and memories.

Collected from the fine layers it forms around hotspots in the loop. Of great value to Specialist Polo as they research the loop.

title: Special elements
description: Special elements are mainly used for refinement, most of them directly or indirectly can be refined into Nanite Cluster. Chromatic Metal and Pugneum can be used to craft various technologies and products. Some were introduced to play a special role in Community Research missions.

title: Star Bulb
description: A beautiful gemstone, this prized product is the engorged, luminescent berry of the lush conditions to thrive in the wild but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponic Tray.

title: Sulphurine
description:
A pungent atmospheric gas. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life.

With the aid of specialised machinery, can be extracted from the atmospheres of

title: Tainted Metal
description: Tainted Metal (Un) is a resource found in Derelict Freighters. It is used to trade for suspicious items and cosmetics with the Scrap Dealer, or for converting into Nanites via refining.

title: Tritium
description:
Radioactive isotope commonly used to fuel the fusion reactor at the heart of starship Pulse Engines.

Abundant in interstellar asteroid fields, Tritium can be mined from asteroids using starship weaponry.

title: Uranium
description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an radioactive environment.

title: Viscous Fluids
description:
An unnaturally thick liquid of dubious colour. Its origins are impossible to fathom.

Appears to have some mild magnetic properties.

title: Void Mote
description: Void Motes are a Voltaic Staff crafting components, and Rebuilt Exosuit Modules from Autophage Synthesis Terminals and Harmonic Interfaces.

infobox.name: Void Mote
infobox.desc: Used as currency with the Autophage.
